title.narrative: CCMN - Cooperativa de Credito das Mulher

participating-org.narrative:
Introduction Cooperativa de Credito das Mulheres de Nampula is a grassrooted OCB, that recently turned into a formal saving and loan institutions, benefiting arround 5000 women in Nampula province. They actions and impact represent a souce of funding for poor people leaving in rural areas.
1. BACKGROUND Was established in 1994, he founded the organization of women who wanted to develop theiractivities and decided to join to help each other in their efforts to improve their performance. they received alternately every two weeks, monetary values, which is commonly known as "xitique" .. The main phases and changes were: 1994 Founded Box Women Nampula (CMN), with the technical assistance of the Canadian Association Cooperatives. In 2003, legally recognized by the Provincial Government of Nampula as an association - Association If Women Nampula, under Law 6/91 of 18 July. 2010: Transformed in Nampula Women CreditCooperative, under Decree 57/2004 - Regulation Microfinance.
2. ACHIEVEMENTS The most important results in the last three years are: increase membership, improve the lives of low-income women in this city, guarantee women's access to health and education (of their children and family) and other facilities such as: (construction of dwelling houses and trade, buying cars and vehicles) introduce significant changes in the position of women in this province. The trajectory of collaborative organization with other donors are good there has been a good interaction mutual, all designed to help grow and develop not only the organization more also associate members.
3. PURPOSE Mission: # Money in a safe place and provide credit to its members to develop business and other services for the improvement of the situation. # Saving money in a safe place and provide credit to its members to develop business and other services for the improvement the socio-economic situation. institutional objectives: # Expand the services provided by the Cooperative, and turn it into a preferred bank of women in the northern region of Mozambique. Field (s) of activity: # Area Nampula City (head office) and Rapale district, serves members of the City of Nampula and Rapale benefiting only women.
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING The cooperative intends to strategically compete in the market and differentiate themselves from their competitors through a more competitive price. Partners play an important role in the growth of the institution. In this context, the comparative value of your organization are: Cooperatives and Humanism showing mutual aid; spirit of cooperation and team, put yourself in the customer's shoes and love your neighbor. And the possibility of advance payments on loans, increase in the level / amount of the loan.
5. PROBLEM ANALYSIS The obstacles are put to structural and lasting improvement in the quality of life of the sectors affected by poverty and economic inequality, social and political, aimed at Cooperative under a gender perspective are: cultural and socias issues of this region that limit women to develop entrepreneurial initiatives / business, by their husbands. One of the causes of these obstacles is the low level of education of the target group. Weak skills in micro- management. Slowness of the judicial system. Much of the population of rural areas do not have identity cards (B.I).
Since the CCMN, knows very well the geographical area and the microcredit business especially for women, the likelihood of success of this intervention is extremely high. The expansion of cooperative activity to Anchiloand Rapale, will directly benefit about 800 low-income women, improving their lives and their families.
6. INTERVENTION STRATEGIES To correct the weak ability of businesses Cooperative has given formations to members in the business area and helps the member tomake a business plan in each paid credit. People who have difficulty in obtaining B.I ask alternative documents. And face the limitation initiatives of Women Entrepreneurs, by their husbands Cooperative had a formation on 11/10/2013 which has pledged to expand the information of Human Rights and the role of Gender through a concentration of people in need. In order to educate members on the principles of cooperation, domestic economy, economic and social rights of women and small businesses thus contributing to reduction of gender inequality.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
